requirements.title: Next.js project setup
requirements.description: Initialize a Next.js project with TypeScript. This is the foundation for both the presenter and participant views.

requirements.title: Real-time infrastructure
requirements.description: Set up WebSocket or equivalent real-time communication so the server can push state changes to all connected clients simultaneously.

requirements.title: Database setup
requirements.description: Set up a lightweight, low-cost database to store sessions, participants, and answers. Must support real-time queries for leaderboard computation.

requirements.title: Production deployment
requirements.description: Configure the project for easy production deployment with all environment variables and database connections working.

requirements.title: Load questions from JSON file
requirements.description: Questions are defined in a local JSON file with their type, options, correct answers, and timer duration. The server reads this file to drive the quiz.

requirements.title: Multiple choice — single answer
requirements.description: A question type where one option is correct and participants can select exactly one answer.

requirements.title: Multiple choice — multi-answer
requirements.description: A question type where multiple options can be correct and participants can select multiple answers.

requirements.title: Number slider with log scale
requirements.description: A question type where participants position a slider on a logarithmic scale to guess a number. The slider range and correct value are defined in the JSON.

requirements.title: Ranking — drag and drop
requirements.description: A question type where participants drag and drop items into the correct order. Must work well on mobile touch devices.

requirements.title: Per-question timer
requirements.description: Each question has a configurable timer duration defined in the JSON. The timer is displayed to both the presenter and participants.

requirements.title: Join via QR code
requirements.description: The presenter view displays a QR code that participants can scan to open the participant view and join the session.

requirements.title: Join via 4-digit code
requirements.description: Participants can navigate to the app URL and enter a 4-digit room code to join a session.

requirements.title: Name entry on join
requirements.description: After joining, participants enter their display name before they can participate in the quiz.

requirements.title: Show joining participants on presenter view
requirements.description: As participants join and enter their names, their names appear on the presenter view in real time so everyone can see who has joined.

requirements.title: Synchronized question delivery
requirements.description: When the presenter advances to the next question, all participants receive and see the new question at the same time.

requirements.title: Synchronized timer
requirements.description: The timer countdown is synchronized so it ends at the exact same moment for all participants. The server determines the end time and all clients count down to it.

requirements.title: Live answer count on presenter view
requirements.description: During an active question, the presenter view shows how many participants have submitted an answer without revealing what they answered.

requirements.title: Speed-based scoring for correct answers
requirements.description: Correct answers earn up to 1000 points. The fastest correct answer gets 1000 and slower correct answers get proportionally fewer. Incorrect or missing answers get 0.

requirements.title: Slider scoring by proximity
requirements.description: For number slider questions, the closest answer to the correct value gets 1000 points. Points drop off based on distance on the log scale. Ties receive equal points.

requirements.title: Ranking partial credit
requirements.description: For ranking questions, participants receive partial credit based on how many items they placed in the correct position.

requirements.title: Presenter view — question display
requirements.description: The presenter view shows the current question text and all answer options while a round is active.

requirements.title: Presenter view — answer distribution
requirements.description: After a round ends, the presenter view reveals a breakdown of how participants answered, showing counts per option or a distribution chart.

requirements.title: Leaderboard between questions
requirements.description: After showing results for each question, the presenter view displays a leaderboard with cumulative scores before advancing to the next question.

requirements.title: Final podium reveal
requirements.description: After the last question, the presenter view shows a podium-style reveal with suspense — announcing 3rd place, then 2nd, then 1st, one by one.

requirements.title: Participant view — question and answer UI
requirements.description: Participants see the question text and can submit their answer using the appropriate input for the question type (buttons, checkboxes, slider, or drag-and-drop).

requirements.title: Mobile-first participant layout
requirements.description: The participant view is designed mobile-first for phone screens. All interactions (tapping, sliding, dragging) work well on touch devices.
